page.title: 01BELFAST GAZETTEER
page.content:
The area we were given to study has the new M2 running North-South nearly {splitting it in half.} To the east of the motorway is the Belfast Lough, Docks and Shipyard. To the west is where all the houses are, including our school. Facing our school is the Grove Baths (at the moment the biggest in Belfast). The three main parks in our part of Belfast are Grove, Cliftonville and St Marys Gardens. {To the NorthWest of the motorway}is where most of the people live with big houses and big gardens which are spaced by a couple of yards. Down our way{(the southwest)}is a differant story altogether because it's packed full of streets and has hardly any open spaces.
Melanie Gordon.
